channel.title: Questions about torrenting, and Ipods
channel.description: Hello. I'm currently downloading the Torrent http://www.torrentspy.com/torrent/309679/AO_Gundam_Wing_Complete. Its downloading fine, but it is in a file type I'm not all that familiar with. When I torrent, I generally stick to movies to put on my Ipod. I use the video converter Videora Ipod converter (found by google-ing videora), and I want to know if just running the .ogm files through this will put the movies in English, Japanese, or Japanese with English sub-titles. Also, if there is a better/faster converter, that would be really helpful too.

item.title: Questions about torrenting, and Ipods
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The core just plays using directshow filters, so if media player dosen’t play it on his pc, the core won’t either.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about torrenting, and Ipods
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

http://www.free-codecs.com/download/The_Core_Media_Player.htm

You need that to play it.

item.description:
@Death_Pal wrote:

Ya, I’ve been working on it and I’m still throughly confused. I found a converter, but it doesn’t support .ogm. I also have some movies in .bin if anyone has any advice for that too. [br][size=1]Posted on: January 15, 2007, 06:15:02 PM[/size][hr]Sorry to bump this, but I don’t want to make a new topic and I really need to know if this is even possible.

When I torrent, I generally stick to movies to put on my Ipod.
